content.title: Pradhan Mantri Dakshta Aur Kushalta Sampann Hitgrahi (PM-DAKSH)
content.department: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
content.beneficiary: Marginalized target groups including SCs, OBCs, EBCs, DNTs, and Safai Karamcharis
content.details: The scheme aims to economically empower marginalized groups through skill training, targeting to skill around 2,71,000 individuals over five years with a budget of ₹ 450.25 crore.
benefits: Free of-cost training through 100% government grants
Monthly stipend of ₹ 1,000/- to ₹ 1,500/- for eligible trainees
Wage compensation of ₹ 3,000/- for eligible trainees
Certification upon successful completion of training
Placement assistance after assessment and certification
eligibility: Other Backward Class (OBC) with annual family income below ₹ 3,00,000
Economically Backward Class (EBC) with annual family income below ₹ 1,00,000
content.application_process: Online application through the official website pmdaksh.dosje.gov.in.
documents_required: OBC Certificate and Income Certificate for OBCs
Certificate and ID Card for TG Community

faqs.question: What Is PM-DAKSH Yojana?
faqs.answer: PM-DAKSH was launched by the Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment to skill marginalized persons covering SCs, OBCs, EBCs, DNTs, and sanitation workers.

faqs.question: What Is The Main Objective Of PM-DAKSH Yojana?
faqs.answer: To increase the skill levels of the target youth by providing short-term and long-term skills, followed by assistance in wage/self-employment.

faqs.question: What Types Of Skill Development Training Programmes Are Available?
faqs.answer: There are four types: Up-skilling/Re-skilling, Short Term Training, Long Term Training, and Entrepreneurship Development Programmes.
